replies.content:
Hey Boys,

Welcome to the 2019-2020 CloudMates Platform available for all students attending Upper Canada College.

Our official domain is "cloudmates.ca" , so please use that to visit the platform. We are proud to provide all of you with daily weather, announcements, lunch menus, a place to talk and much more. Before using the Mentor section of this platform, please make sure to follow the General Rules and Guidelines. These rules are designed to make sure this platform is safe and fun for everyone.

Mentor Forum General Rules and Guidelines

  1. Swearing will be blocked, and there is no tolerance for avoidance.
  2. Respect all users using the platform.
  3. Absolutely NO bullying, discriminating, disrespecting, harassing, hating on another person or group
  4. Do not post content with the purpose of cheating points or beating the system.
  5. Do not post content inteded to mislead, lure, or shock users
  6. Respect all staff members in any scenario
  7. Do not post pornographic, sexually explicit, graphic, or otherwise NSFW content.
  8. Attempt not to share personal information of yourself or other students in the college
  9. Do not share your account passwords or other login credentials with other members
  10. Do not spam or promote spam anywhere on our site.
  11. Make sure your content and actions follows ALL rules of the Upper Canada College Technology Use Guidelines
  12. Do not try to hack or inject any features or components of the platform.

This site is for Educational and Student Life Efficiency purposes only, not a place to execute actions that are not permitted on school property, a complete list of these actions and their consequences will be in the SUCC Family Handbook.
All staff members are here to regulate activity and provide support for all users of the site, staff members will not abuse or attempt to provide a specific advantage or harm to any individual. If you see a staff member not executing his duty, you may submit a report to alen.niu@ucc.on.ca . If you find any bugs or errors, you may also send an email to a member of the staff team and then if confirmed, you will receive a compensation. Once again, actions and content on this site must follow the UCC Technology Use and UCC Family Handbook Guidelines. If any of these rules (including UCC's) are violated, staff are given permissions to execute consequences. More serious violations will be reported to school administration.

Other than that, CloudMates is an amazing platform for all students to receieve help, relieve stress, and smoothen student life. In this forum you may post content regarding anything related to academics or school life (sports, events, music, arts, etc). You may ask for help or talk for any category as long as it follows the guidelines above. Points are awarded based on posted messages, replies and given away during events or assemblies.

We hope that you enjoy CloudMates and have fun while learning new things here. Other than that;

GO BLUES GO!!!

title: Standard Math - Callegaro
content: What is the part of a polynomial called that is separated by "+" or a "-" called?

replies.content: They are called terms. Check out this link. https://www.studypug.com/algebra-help/polynomial-components

I'm not sure if this is what you meant to ask, but here you go. 

For example, if we had the binomial 15x + 12, 

15x would be a term, 

and 12 would be another term. 

Monomial means a one-term polynomial (ex. 15x)

Binomial means a two-term polynomial (ex. 15x+12)

Trinomial means a three-term polynomial (ex. 3x^2 + 15x + 12)

Any number alone would be a single term and therefore a monomial such as {x2s•23x18999]

Something seperated by a + or - once example 15x+4 would be a binomial

Something seperated by a + or - twice example 12+3x-x2 would be known as a trinomial.

IMPORTANT REMINDER: Multiplication and/or division signs do not seperate terms. All of the examples shown above are expressions NOT EQUATIONS.

Thanks
Also I think the test is next wednesday

That means, for example, that 2x means two times x, or twice x. If x is 7, then 2x is 14. The parts of a polynomial separated by plus or minus signs are called "terms". The plus sign or minus sign are part of the term. ... If a polynomial has only one term, it is called a "monomial".
Emerson, what do you mean by algebraric language?

There are multiple possible meanings

-Mathematical terminology (ex. quadratics, coefficients. terms, functions, etc)

-Language used to describe algebra (ex. two times x)

-Turning word problems into algebra (ex. Bob has two more than x apples)
check out this link for algebraic language: http://www.math.com/school/subject2/lessons/S2U1L1DP.html

title: Design Triff
content: Questions relation to design

replies.content:
In general, dimensions include:

The bottom has to be off the ground (Higher than the fishing hook), 2-5cm height range for launcher

No minimum (except for cartridge, 3cmx6cm)

Maximum: Has to fit within your drawer

GO TO MS. TRIFF'S WEBSITE TO FIND OUT. You don't have to ask 100 questions. You can find everything here: https://sites.google.com/ucc.on.ca/triffyear8design/product-dragster-challenge/developing-ideas

Based on the competition rules previously published a Dragster fit for competition must:

SIZE / SIGNIFICANT DIMENSIONS

  • not exceed any of these maximum dimensions: L 42 cm x W 30.75 cm x H 15.5 cm (the size of your storage drawer)
  • have an underbody/chassis clearance a minimum of 1.0 cm above the track (accounting for axel position and guide-wire eyelet clearance)
  • have the centre of the CO2 cartridge located 2.5 cm - 5 cm above the track to fit in the starting gate

​TOOLS + MATERIALS

  • include a significant LASER CUT part designed by you and made with at least one of these materials: cardboard sheet, acrylic sheet, or wood sheet
  • include a 3D printed part designed by you and made with one of the plastic filaments provided in class (part must be printable in under an hour)
  • use the axles and wheels provided (or you may design your own)
  • have two guide-wire eyelets secured to the underbody / chassis (one toward the front of the car, one toward the rear of the car)

FORM + APPEARANCE

  • be well crafted in terms of appearance, precision, fit & finish
  • follow the basic principles of aerodynamic design
  • utilize the inherent colours of the materials selected in a considered aesthetic manner
  • not use excess paint, or modelling compounds

title: Please define Independent and Dependent variables. (For rust lab).
content: K thx bye

replies.content:
Independent variables are ones that you manipulate and change

This would be the treatement you use

Dependent variables are what you're measuring

In this case it would be the height of the water in the pipette
So the dependent ones are un-changeable?
Arthur you could have put that into one message- yes the dependant variable is essentially unchangeable.
Independent variables are ones that you manipulate and change
yes the dependant variable is essentially unchangeable.
Yes... as they said independent = the variables you purposely change (grade of steel, treatment etc.), the dependent is essentially the result. (change in mass (g), % surface rusted, colour, etc.)

The two main variables in an experiment are the independent and dependent variable. An independent variable is the variable that is changed or controlled in a scientific experiment to test the effects on the dependent variable. A dependent variable is the variable being tested and measured in a scientific experiment.

title: Lose points
content: Why do you suddenly lose 100 points for no reason

replies.content: You can only lose points if you have posted inappropriate or mod flagged content. If this is not the case, I suggest you contact our support team at support@cloudmates.ca
If you kept writing spam, it was probably deleted by a moderator. Make sure all your comments are constructive and helpful, not just for points.

Well if your posts or replies you posted before were completely irrelevant or flagged as "spammy" meaning posting multiple unnecessary replies continuously. 

The moderators are told to remove these kinds of posts/replies and thus you will lose -15 points while only gaining +10 points for a reply. Resulting in a -5 Net loss of points. 

If you believe that your replies are actually helpful and removed for no reason, you can just send me an email.

😁

title: Design Brief
content: Does anybody know how to create a design brief for design courses? If so, please explain and give an example. Thanks

replies.content: Write the 5Ws and then add an intro.
thx

Here's the example slide from Coding:

Develop a design brief for your design challenge. Write a few sentences that include the following: A description of your problem, the needs of your client, and how your product might solve this problem. If you have a product in mind do not describe your product yet, we will do that in part 2.

As a designer, I will design and create a product that….



Sample Design brief: As we become more technologically advanced, we produce materials that can withstand extreme temperatures, are durable and easy to use. Plastic bags, plastic bottles, cans, and computer hardware are some of the things that make life easy for us but what we forget is that these advanced products do not break down naturally when we dispose them. The air, moisture, climate, or soil cannot break them down naturally. They are not biodegradable. As a designer, I will create a new product using the waste that can benefit humankind and the environment. I will create a documentary to inform the public about my discovery and design. 

Here's what you'll be evaluated on: (7/8 band)

  1. Explains and justifies the need for a solution for a familiar group of people.
  2. Constructs a research plan which states and prioritizes the research needed to develop a solution to the problem independently
  3. Analyses a group of similar products that inspire a solution to the problem presents the analysis of the findings from a range of sources, related to the development of a possible solution, cited appropriately.

title: Y12 Math
content: What is the difference beween binomial pdf and cdf on your calculator?
